intro: Conostylis androstemma, commonly known as the narrow-leafed conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces yellowish or pinkish flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Conostylis androstemma is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands.
